tn.ref: virgin Israel has fallen ... she will ... she is ... raise her
tn.text: "the people of Israel have died violently ... they will ... they are ... raise them"

tn.ref: Seek me
tn.text: "Come to me for help"

tn.ref: Bethel will become nothing
tn.text: "Bethel will be completely destroyed" AT: "people will come and completely destroy Bethel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: he will break out like fire
tn.text: "he will become like a fire that breaks out suddenly and destroys everything" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: turn justice into a bitter thing and throw righteousness down to the ground
tn.text: call evil things good and treat good things as unimportant

tn.ref: turn justice into a bitter thing
tn.text: or "twist justice" or "do what is not just but say it is just" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: throw righteousness down to the ground
tn.text: or "treat righteousness as though it were as unimportant as dirt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: the Pleiades and Orion
tn.text: groups of stars (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_unknown]])

tn.ref: trample down
tn.text: "greatly oppress" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: turn aside the needy in the city gate
tn.text: "do not allow the poor to bring their cases to the judges"

tn.ref: any prudent person is silent
tn.text: Those who do not want the evil people to harm them will not speak out against the evil deeds.

tn.ref: establish justice in the city gate
tn.text: or "see that justice is done in the courts at the city gates" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Wailing
tn.text: long, loud, sad cries

tn.ref: Why do you long for the day of Yahweh?
tn.text: AT: "You should not long for the day of Yahweh!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: It will be darkness and not light
tn.text: "Bad things, not good things, will happen on that day"

tn.ref: Will not the day of Yahweh be darkness and not light?
tn.text: AT: "The day of Yahweh will certainly be darkness and not light!" or "Bad things, not good things, will certainly happen on the day of Yahweh!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I hate, I despise your festivals
tn.text: The word "despise" is a strong word for "hate." Together the two words emphasize the intensity of Yahweh's hatred for their religious festivals. AT: "I hate your festivals very much." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: noise
tn.text: unpleasant sounds

tn.ref: Did you bring me sacrifices ... Israel?
tn.text: AT: Possibly 1) "I did not command you to bring me sacrifices ... Israel!" or 2) "It was not to me that you brought sacrifices ... Israel!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Sikkuth ... Kaiwan
tn.text: pagan gods (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Kaiwan
tn.text: Or "Kiyyun"
